alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 08 at 5:58AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Southeastern Brooks Range. This includes the cities of Arctic Village, Wiseman, Coldfoot, Chandalar Dot Camp, And Iniakuk Lake. * WHEN...From 10 AM AKDT this morning through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms with heavy rain showers moved across the Eastern Brooks Range Friday night into this morning. A more widespread area of heavy showers is expected to move over the Eastern Brooks Range today. Between 0.50 inch and 1.5 inches of rain is expected to fall today. It is uncertain exactly which river basins will get the heaviest rain. The heavy rain will fall in a short period of time meaning that creeks and small rivers in steep terrain could rise very rapidly today in the areas that get the heaviest rain. Larger rivers will rise tonight and Sunday, but at this time it is uncertain if larger rivers will flood. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People in the Brooks Range should be alert to the possibility of rapidly rising water levels along creeks and small rivers today, and along larger rivers tonight.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
